member.name: T:Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice
member.summary:
Motor device class
The %motor device is a single device representing exactly one logical module on a sias instrument.
member.details:
\ingroup Dev_Motor
The class is implemented in \ref Dev_Motor. It implements - configuration properties for default speeds and ramps, - a configuration property for the maximum move range, - configuration properties for the scaling and axis units ([mm] or [°]), - properties for the last known or actual positions, - methods to convert positions (in [mm] or [°]) to or from %motor units and - methods for different kind of moves (absolute, relative, block , scan, ...) .
The %motor device expects a connected CAN device implementing the %motor module interface messages like - \nlink{Sias::CanDev::SCanMsg,CanMsg_Init}: Init %motor - \nlink{Sias::CanDev::SCanMsg,CanMsg_Move}: Move %motor absolute or relative - optional \nlink{Sias::CanDev::SCanMsg,CanMsg_SetLqMode}: Set liquid detector mode
%SMotorDevice class diagram
\image html "SMotorDevice.png"

member.name: M:Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice.#ctor
member.summary:
Default constructor
This constructor creates a device with all configuration members to its default values.

member.name: M:Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary:
XML string configuration constructor
This constructor creates a device by parsing the device parameters from the given XML configuration string.

member.summary:
Manual generation constructor
This constructor creates a device by using the given parameters.

member.name: M:Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice.ToMot(System.Double)
member.summary: Get %motor device position [units] from %motor position [mm] or [°]

member.name: M:Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice.ToMotSpeed(System.Double)
member.summary: Get %motor device speed [units/s] from %motor speed [mm/s] or [°/s]

member.name: M:Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice.ToMotRamp(System.Double)
member.summary: Get %motor device acceleration [units/s²] from %motor acceleration [mm/s²] or [°/s²]

member.name: M:Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice.ToInitSpeed(System.Double)
member.summary: Get %motor device init speed [units/s] from %motor init speed [mm/s] or [°/s]

member.name: M:Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice.ToPos(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get %motor position [mm] or [°] from %motor device position [units]

member.name: M:Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice.GetErrorInfos
member.summary: This interface function returns the default error messages which can be generated by this device.

member.name: M:Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice.HandleModuleError(System.Boolean,System.Object[])
member.summary: This method handles the module errors of SMotor devices
member.details:
Possible Module types: 0x0002 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_TYPE_CONST "MT_MOTOR_2DC_P1") 0x0003 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_TYPE_CONST "MT_MOTOR_2DC_P2") 0x0004 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_TYPE_CONST "MT_MOTOR_2DC_V1") 0x0005 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_TYPE_CONST "MT_MCB_DC_MOTOR") 0x0010 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_TYPE_CONST "MT_DC_PUMP_V1") 0x0030 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_TYPE_CONST "MT_BC_RACK") ? 0x0031 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_TYPE_CONST "MT_MCB_IDTRAX") 0xFFE1 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_TYPE_CONST "MT_BASE_540")?
Handled errors: 0x01 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_ERROR_CONST "ME_INIT_ERROR") at Error1 0x02 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_ERROR_CONST "ME_MOVE_ERROR") at Error1 0x04 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_ERROR_CONST "ME_INVALID_MOD") at Error1 0x0F (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_ERROR_CONST "ME_NO_LS_FOUND") at Error1 and Error2
member.param: true to force the handler to handle the error

member.name: M:Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice.Init(Sias.BaseDev.SDeviceInitOptions)
member.summary:
Single motor init method.
Mostly this init method is not called if the motor device is a sub device of another device e.g. an arm device or an Y/Z devices.
member.param: Initialization options (Init level (PreInit, Init, PostInit, UserInit) and Init Group 0..7)

member.name: M:Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice.CheckMove(System.Double,System.Byte,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: This method checks the %motors destination position before moving the %motor. It gets called from the %motor move methods.

member.name: M:Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice.PrepareMove(System.Double,System.Byte,System.Double,System.Double)
member.param: Destination position (absolute or relative depends on Options)

member.name: M:Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice.PrepareScanMove(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.param: Destination position for movement after detection (relative to detect position)

member.name: M:Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice.PrepareInitMove(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Prepare for %motor init move \n \n (in difference to Init this method will set the MM_RELATIVE flag)

member.name: P:Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice.SpeedFactor
member.summary:
General Speed factor property
This property may be used to reduce the speed of ALL motors in Nelsn SDK. I may only be used for teaching or debugging purposes as it will not allow a correct tracking ...

member.name: P:Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice.Pos
member.summary: Last known %motor position. If the %motor is not moving and no external force is attached to the %motor this will be identical to the actual position.

member.name: P:Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice.PosFromDevice
member.summary: Current %motor position. \n In difference to property Pos, this property will actively request the actual position from the motor. So the position will also recognize position changes evoked by external force.

member.name: T:Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice.ErrorCodes
member.summary: This static class keeps the error code constants of the \ref Sias::Motor::SMotorDevice errors.

member.name: F:Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice.ErrorCodes.InitError
member.summary: 0x1301: Unable to initialize motor. No block and no index position found.

member.name: F:Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice.ErrorCodes.MoveError
member.summary: 0x1302: %Motor movement blocked. %Motor is unable to reach the destination position.

member.name: F:Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice.ErrorCodes.DeviceHardwareError
member.summary: 0x1304: Unable to initialize the device hardware.

member.name: F:Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice.ErrorCodes.NoValidLevelSensorConfig
member.summary: 0x130F: Unable to find a valid level sensor configuration.

member.name: F:Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice.ErrorCodes.NoLevelSensor
member.summary: 0x138F: Unable to initialize level sensor hardware.
